node.title: How to improve self-esteem
node.excerpt: People should know how to improve self-esteem and this post will provides you with more information on some actions that you can take to improve it.
node.custom_excerpt: People should know how to improve self-esteem and this post will provides you with more information on some actions that you can take to improve it.
node.meta_description: People should know how to improve self-esteem and this post will provides you with more information on some actions that you can take to improve it.

authors.name: Daegyun Na
authors.bio: "The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes"

primary_author.name: Daegyun Na
primary_author.bio: "The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes"

node.plaintext:
> Self-esteem is how you feel about yourself and everyone has times to feel low,
which can lead to problems including mental health such as depression or
anxiety.
Doctors advise following things in order to improve self-esteem.

Cook and eat well plated food for yourself
It may make you unconsciously think that you are valuable and precious. Usually,
people with low self-esteem often eat simple meals alone and eat very tasty food
with friends.

Photo by Louis Hansel @shotsoflouis
[https://unsplash.com/@louishansel?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
Buy a gift item for yourself
It doesn't matter whether it's one dollar or not. I am generous by buying gifts
for other people but not for myself and always try to choose reasonable or the
cheapest. Recently I bought an audio for myself as a gift and I feel more
happier than before when listening to music.

Photo by Jon Tyson
[https://unsplash.com/@jontyson?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
Compliment yourself
People with low self-esteem say bad things to themselves  without hesitation.
Don't forget that these words can hurt yourself.

Photo by engin akyurt
[https://unsplash.com/@enginakyurt?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
Make your favorite time and place
The fact that self-esteem has decreased can be seen as a burden of mind that is
difficult for the person to bear. So, making your favorite time and place where
you can reflash yourself is a real rest.

Photo by Sacha Verheij
[https://unsplash.com/@sachaverheij?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
Make action plans you want
Let's make a very easy acttion plan you want such as dog walking, take a walk
for 5 minutes. A sense of accomplishment and rewards for me can be achieved
through such a plan.

Photo by Delphine Beausoleil
[https://unsplash.com/@dbeausoleil?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
I hope the above five things can help you improve your self-esteem, and will
introduce more ways to improve.

> don't foget that we all so valuable and precious.
node.html:
Self-esteem is how you feel about yourself and everyone has times to feel low, which can lead to problems including mental health such as depression or anxiety.

Doctors advise following things in order to improve self-esteem.

Cook and eat well plated food for yourself

It may make you unconsciously think that you are valuable and precious. Usually, people with low self-esteem often eat simple meals alone and eat very tasty food with friends.

Buy a gift item for yourself

It doesn't matter whether it's one dollar or not. I am generous by buying gifts for other people but not for myself and always try to choose reasonable or the cheapest. Recently I bought an audio for myself as a gift and I feel more happier than before when listening to music.

Compliment yourself

People with low self-esteem say bad things to themselves without hesitation. Don't forget that these words can hurt yourself.

Make your favorite time and place

The fact that self-esteem has decreased can be seen as a burden of mind that is difficult for the person to bear. So, making your favorite time and place where you can reflash yourself is a real rest.

Make action plans you want

Let's make a very easy acttion plan you want such as dog walking, take a walk for 5 minutes. A sense of accomplishment and rewards for me can be achieved through such a plan.

I hope the above five things can help you improve your self-esteem, and will introduce more ways to improve.

don't foget that we all so valuable and precious.

childHtmlRehype.html:
Self-esteem is how you feel about yourself and everyone has times to feel low, which can lead to problems including mental health such as depression or anxiety.

Doctors advise following things in order to improve self-esteem.

Cook and eat well plated food for yourself

It may make you unconsciously think that you are valuable and precious. Usually, people with low self-esteem often eat simple meals alone and eat very tasty food with friends.

Buy a gift item for yourself

It doesn't matter whether it's one dollar or not. I am generous by buying gifts for other people but not for myself and always try to choose reasonable or the cheapest. Recently I bought an audio for myself as a gift and I feel more happier than before when listening to music.

Compliment yourself

People with low self-esteem say bad things to themselves without hesitation. Don't forget that these words can hurt yourself.

Make your favorite time and place

The fact that self-esteem has decreased can be seen as a burden of mind that is difficult for the person to bear. So, making your favorite time and place where you can reflash yourself is a real rest.

Make action plans you want

Let's make a very easy acttion plan you want such as dog walking, take a walk for 5 minutes. A sense of accomplishment and rewards for me can be achieved through such a plan.

I hope the above five things can help you improve your self-esteem, and will introduce more ways to improve.

don't foget that we all so valuable and precious.

node.title: Child with low self-esteem
node.excerpt: Child with low self-esteem has specific characteristics and we will find them in this post and take a look at your child what he or she has.
node.custom_excerpt: Child with low self-esteem has specific characteristics and we will find them in this post and take a look at your child what he or she has.
node.meta_description: Child with low self-esteem has specific characteristics and we will find them in this post and take a look at your child what he or she has.

authors.name: Daegyun Na
authors.bio: "The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes"

primary_author.name: Daegyun Na
primary_author.bio: "The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes"

node.plaintext:
Child with low self-esteem
In general, children with well-developed self-esteem have a stable level of
self-esteem, whereas children with low self-esteem often change their level of
self-esteem. Depending on the situation, self-esteem increases or decreases
rapidly. 

In this case, you have to go through a high level of self-esteem several times
and help build a stable self-esteem for your child. Of course, just because you
see something like the one below doesn't mean your child has a big problem. 

It is an important time when you should observe your child a little more and
help the child feel more positive and confident.

Photo by H W
[https://unsplash.com/@h_w?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
Here are most representative characteristics of child with low self-esteem.

They are afraid of Failure
If they feel like they are going to lose, they stop or give up because they are
afraid of failure. Even if they compete, they think giving up is better than
losing. They think, "I gave up on purpose." and give up like that creates the
thought of‘It is okay because I am not lost.’.

They don't challenge things likely to fail
Children with high self-esteem are not afraid of failure and challenge things
whereas children with low self-esteem do not challenge at all because they are
afraid of failure. It is because the frustration of failure is so loud and
scary. They hope they have only successful memories in their memory.

The result is more important than the process
When they work, they think that whatever the process is, only the result needs
to be good. Because the most important thing for them is successful result
rather than hard work and experiences.

Shortcut is ok If the result is good
If the result can be good, they think the shortcut in the process is okay. If
you take a child solving a problem book for example, you can see it well.
Children with high self-esteem focus on the ability to solve problems,
regardless of the severity or amount of the problem. If there is a wrong
problem, they look closely at it, and they go over the front to see why they are
wrong. 

However, children with low self-esteem focus on completing the problem book
quickly or on the number of circles. they focus on what they can show others.
Therefore, they increase the number of circles by looking at the answers and
solving them or by correcting the wrong answer when grading.

Play more than necessary to hide the frustration
They hate letting others know of a failed situation and cannot stand the
frustration. They try to pass over their desire to escape with a joke or
something else. They want to divert their attention by playing around.

They are seen putting off what they have to do
When they are afraid that they will fail, they tend to put off work and try to
create a situation where they don't have to.

They push others to hide their inadequacies
They re extremely reluctant to reveal their low self-esteem, failing situation,
or inadequacy. It is because it is scary that others will be frustrated again
when they learn about themselves. That is why they act to push others or
deliberately show exaggeration.

They don't admit reality in adverse circumstances
When a situation is unfavorable to them, they often don't admit the reality and
talk about other situations.

Make excuses in advance
If the result is not good, they make excuses or say less importance for poor
result, such as saying, ‘I didn’t care about this very much, so I purposely
avoided it.’

The result is returned to other people
When the outcome of work is not good, the responsibility is returned to the
environment or to someone else in order for them to avoid being criticized for
their responsibilities.

Other characteristics
Other characteristics act to appease others, constantly check for love, or care
very much about the gaze of others. A child with high self-esteem and well
developed self-esteem can make rational and proactive decisions and cope well
with negative psychology. However, children with low self-esteem cannot bear to
experience failure, so they keep trying to avoid it. But you also have to be
careful if your self-esteem is excessive. If you have excessive self-esteem,'I'm
good at everything. Because there is a possibility of falling into the supremacy
of "I am superior".

Photo by Marisa Howenstine
[https://unsplash.com/@marisahowenstine?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
It is observing what your children are saying and about presenting a very simple
frustrating situation such as asking them to listen to something and giving them
a toy that is still difficult for children to do and seeing what they will say
after a failure. In contrast, children with low self-esteem say things like "So
I said I could not or look I thought I chould not."

In the next post, we will find a way to improve or develop self-esteem. 

See you soon!
node.html:
Child with low self-esteem

In general, children with well-developed self-esteem have a stable level of self-esteem, whereas children with low self-esteem often change their level of self-esteem. Depending on the situation, self-esteem increases or decreases rapidly.

In this case, you have to go through a high level of self-esteem several times and help build a stable self-esteem for your child. Of course, just because you see something like the one below doesn't mean your child has a big problem.

It is an important time when you should observe your child a little more and help the child feel more positive and confident.

Here are most representative characteristics of child with low self-esteem.

They are afraid of Failure

If they feel like they are going to lose, they stop or give up because they are afraid of failure. Even if they compete, they think giving up is better than losing. They think, "I gave up on purpose." and give up like that creates the thought of  ‘It is okay because I am not lost.’.

They don't challenge things likely to fail

Children with high self-esteem are not afraid of failure and challenge things whereas children with low self-esteem do not challenge at all because they are afraid of failure. It is because the frustration of failure is so loud and scary. They hope they have only successful memories in their memory.

The result is more important than the process

When they work, they think that whatever the process is, only the result needs to be good. Because the most important thing for them is successful result rather than hard work and experiences.

Shortcut is ok If the result is good

If the result can be good, they think the shortcut in the process is okay. If you take a child solving a problem book for example, you can see it well. Children with high self-esteem focus on the ability to solve problems, regardless of the severity or amount of the problem. If there is a wrong problem, they look closely at it, and they go over the front to see why they are wrong.

However, children with low self-esteem focus on completing the problem book quickly or on the number of circles. they focus on what they can show others. Therefore, they increase the number of circles by looking at the answers and solving them or by correcting the wrong answer when grading.

Play more than necessary to hide the frustration

They hate letting others know of a failed situation and cannot stand the frustration. They try to pass over their desire to escape with a joke or something else. They want to divert their attention by playing around.

They are seen putting off what they have to do

When they are afraid that they will fail, they tend to put off work and try to create a situation where they don't have to.

They push others to hide their inadequacies

They re extremely reluctant to reveal their low self-esteem, failing situation, or inadequacy. It is because it is scary that others will be frustrated again when they learn about themselves. That is why they act to push others or deliberately show exaggeration.

They don't admit reality in adverse circumstances

When a situation is unfavorable to them, they often don't admit the reality and talk about other situations.

Make excuses in advance

If the result is not good, they make excuses or say less importance for poor result, such as saying, ‘I didn’t care about this very much, so I purposely avoided it.’

The result is returned to other people

When the outcome of work is not good, the responsibility is returned to the environment or to someone else in order for them to avoid being criticized for their responsibilities.

Other characteristics

Other characteristics act to appease others, constantly check for love, or care very much about the gaze of others. A child with high self-esteem and well developed self-esteem can make rational and proactive decisions and cope well with negative psychology. However, children with low self-esteem cannot bear to experience failure, so they keep trying to avoid it. But you also have to be careful if your self-esteem is excessive. If you have excessive self-esteem,'I'm good at everything. Because there is a possibility of falling into the supremacy of "I am superior".

It is observing what your children are saying and about presenting a very simple frustrating situation such as asking them to listen to something and giving them a toy that is still difficult for children to do and seeing what they will say after a failure. In contrast, children with low self-esteem say things like "So I said I could not or look I thought I chould not."

In the next post, we will find a way to improve or develop self-esteem.

See you soon!

Child with low self-esteem

In general, children with well-developed self-esteem have a stable level of self-esteem, whereas children with low self-esteem often change their level of self-esteem. Depending on the situation, self-esteem increases or decreases rapidly.

In this case, you have to go through a high level of self-esteem several times and help build a stable self-esteem for your child. Of course, just because you see something like the one below doesn't mean your child has a big problem.

It is an important time when you should observe your child a little more and help the child feel more positive and confident.

Here are most representative characteristics of child with low self-esteem.

They are afraid of Failure

If they feel like they are going to lose, they stop or give up because they are afraid of failure. Even if they compete, they think giving up is better than losing. They think, "I gave up on purpose." and give up like that creates the thought of  ‘It is okay because I am not lost.’.

Children with high self-esteem are not afraid of failure and challenge things whereas children with low self-esteem do not challenge at all because they are afraid of failure. It is because the frustration of failure is so loud and scary. They hope they have only successful memories in their memory.

When they work, they think that whatever the process is, only the result needs to be good. Because the most important thing for them is successful result rather than hard work and experiences.

If the result can be good, they think the shortcut in the process is okay. If you take a child solving a problem book for example, you can see it well. Children with high self-esteem focus on the ability to solve problems, regardless of the severity or amount of the problem. If there is a wrong problem, they look closely at it, and they go over the front to see why they are wrong.

However, children with low self-esteem focus on completing the problem book quickly or on the number of circles. they focus on what they can show others. Therefore, they increase the number of circles by looking at the answers and solving them or by correcting the wrong answer when grading.

They hate letting others know of a failed situation and cannot stand the frustration. They try to pass over their desire to escape with a joke or something else. They want to divert their attention by playing around.

They are seen putting off what they have to do

When they are afraid that they will fail, they tend to put off work and try to create a situation where they don't have to.

They push others to hide their inadequacies

They re extremely reluctant to reveal their low self-esteem, failing situation, or inadequacy. It is because it is scary that others will be frustrated again when they learn about themselves. That is why they act to push others or deliberately show exaggeration.

They don't admit reality in adverse circumstances

When a situation is unfavorable to them, they often don't admit the reality and talk about other situations.

Make excuses in advance

If the result is not good, they make excuses or say less importance for poor result, such as saying, ‘I didn’t care about this very much, so I purposely avoided it.’

The result is returned to other people

When the outcome of work is not good, the responsibility is returned to the environment or to someone else in order for them to avoid being criticized for their responsibilities.

Other characteristics act to appease others, constantly check for love, or care very much about the gaze of others. A child with high self-esteem and well developed self-esteem can make rational and proactive decisions and cope well with negative psychology. However, children with low self-esteem cannot bear to experience failure, so they keep trying to avoid it. But you also have to be careful if your self-esteem is excessive. If you have excessive self-esteem,'I'm good at everything. Because there is a possibility of falling into the supremacy of "I am superior".

It is observing what your children are saying and about presenting a very simple frustrating situation such as asking them to listen to something and giving them a toy that is still difficult for children to do and seeing what they will say after a failure. In contrast, children with low self-esteem say things like "So I said I could not or look I thought I chould not."

In the next post, we will find a way to improve or develop self-esteem.

See you soon!

properties.alt: This image was taken for my client, Nannybird—an LA-based nanny service. I shot at a chic hotel in Hollywood and lucked out with the all-white walls that served as a fabulous bounce card for the floor to ceiling windows that had gorgeous afternoon light streaming in. This image was a detail shot for the day, showcasing one of the nannies playing blocks with the children, who were both eagerly engaged—a rare moment for the rambunctious ones!  ; )

node.title: Child with high self-esteem
node.excerpt: Child with high self-esteem has several characteristics, such as being like to have new relationships with new people, empathy, consideration, kind, polite, satisfaction, like new things, passionate, positive way of thinking, using positive words
node.custom_excerpt: Child with high self-esteem has several characteristics, such as being like to have new relationships with new people, empathy, consideration, kind, polite, satisfaction, like new things, passionate, positive way of thinking, using positive words
node.meta_description: Child with high self-esteem has several characteristics, such as being like to have new relationships with new people, empathy, consideration, kind, polite

authors.name: Daegyun Na
authors.bio: "The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes"

primary_author.name: Daegyun Na
primary_author.bio: "The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes"

node.plaintext:
> What about the level of self-esteem for my child, the belief that I can and love
myself? Is my child a child with low self-esteem? A child with high self-esteem?
Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and
think about what kind of child you are!
Child with high self-esteem
As discussed in the previous post of people with high esteem
[/people-with-high-self-esteem/], the characteristics of people with high were
listed and now we will look child with high self-esteem through and through in
this post.

What about the level of self-esteem of your child? Is your child a child with
high or low self-esteem? Is it a high child? Take a closer look at the
characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of
 your child is. 

Photo by Limor Zellermayer
[https://unsplash.com/@limorganon?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
A child with high self-esteem has following characteristics. If your child has
more than 6 characteristics below, you can think of him or her as having
high-esteem overall. 

No fear to have relationships with other people
They don’t have any fear of having relationships with other people. Children
with high self-esteem are not afraid to talk to new people because they are
confident that other people will also like themselves.

Empathy and consideration
Self-respect can also lead to others. They already know that the relationship
through empathy and consideration is very stable. It is because they learned the
attitude or method of maintaining a good relationship through the successful
relationships they have been through.

Kind and polite
They are kind and polite. They learn how to communicate with others by seeing
what other people are doing to them. They learn the kind and polite aspects they
have received, and they do it same.

Satisfaction
They know how to be satisfied with their achievements. Basically children do not
overconfident or underestimate their abilities. Children with well-developed
self-esteem know how to be purely happy with the achievements they have
achieved. Satisfaction with these achievements become the energy to challenge
new things.

New things
They have confidence and try new things well. They know how to be happy and
satisfied with his achievements. A feeling of joy makes them not afraid to take
on other challenges. they feel that challenging a new thing itself is not a
frightening thing but a joyful thing that gives you another joy.

Passionate
They try to do things proactively and proactively. When they do things, they
don't act passively and passively. They always try to be proactive and take the
initiative.

Positive way of thinking
They are not good at negative thoughts. They focus on the current situation.
What if this doesn't work? What if this goes wrong? Instead of being restless,
they enjoy and focus on the current situation. Even if they have negative
thoughts, they think they can quickly come up with a countermeasure or try
harder.

Positive words
They don't use pessimistic words well and words that deny reality or pessimistic
words. They express themselves with positive words.

Responsibility
They put the responsibility of work on themselves and think that they are
responsible for doing something. If they are making a big house out of blocks
and it doesn't work well, they think that they will just need a little more and
keep challenging or they guess they tried to make it too big. Then they will
think "shall we change it a little bit more?"

Never frustrated
They are not very frustrated if they fail something. Even if they fail and
suffer frustration, they won't get hurt very much. They just think of ways to
overcome failures. Because they know that with a little more effort, they can
experience other successes.

Photo by MI PHAM
[https://unsplash.com/@phammi?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit] 
/ Unsplash
[https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=ghost&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=api-credit]
What is the result of the level of your child for self-esteem with above
features? In the next post, the characteristics of child with low self-esteem
[/child-with-low-self-esteem/] will be introduced.
node.html:
What about the level of self-esteem for my child, the belief that I can and love myself? Is my child a child with low self-esteem? A child with high self-esteem?
Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of child you are!

Child with high self-esteem

As discussed in the previous post of people with high esteem, the characteristics of people with high were listed and now we will look child with high self-esteem through and through in this post.

What about the level of self-esteem of your child? Is your child a child with high or low self-esteem? Is it a high child? Take a closer look at the characteristics of a child with high self-esteem and think about what kind of  your child is.

A child with high self-esteem has following characteristics. If your child has more than 6 characteristics below, you can think of him or her as having high-esteem overall.

No fear to have relationships with other people

They don’t have any fear of having relationships with other people. Children with high self-esteem are not afraid to talk to new people because they are confident that other people will also like themselves.

Empathy and consideration

Self-respect can also lead to others. They already know that the relationship through empathy and consideration is very stable. It is because they learned the attitude or method of maintaining a good relationship through the successful relationships they have been through.

Kind and polite

They are kind and polite. They learn how to communicate with others by seeing what other people are doing to them. They learn the kind and polite aspects they have received, and they do it same.

Satisfaction

They know how to be satisfied with their achievements. Basically children do not overconfident or underestimate their abilities. Children with well-developed self-esteem know how to be purely happy with the achievements they have achieved. Satisfaction with these achievements become the energy to challenge new things.

New things

They have confidence and try new things well. They know how to be happy and satisfied with his achievements. A feeling of joy makes them not afraid to take on other challenges. they feel that challenging a new thing itself is not a frightening thing but a joyful thing that gives you another joy.

Passionate

They try to do things proactively and proactively. When they do things, they don't act passively and passively. They always try to be proactive and take the initiative.

Positive way of thinking

They are not good at negative thoughts. They focus on the current situation. What if this doesn't work? What if this goes wrong? Instead of being restless, they enjoy and focus on the current situation. Even if they have negative thoughts, they think they can quickly come up with a countermeasure or try harder.

Positive words

They don't use pessimistic words well and words that deny reality or pessimistic words. They express themselves with positive words.

Responsibility

They put the responsibility of work on themselves and think that they are responsible for doing something. If they are making a big house out of blocks and it doesn't work well, they think that they will just need a little more and keep challenging or they guess they tried to make it too big. Then they will think "shall we change it a little bit more?"

Never frustrated

They are not very frustrated if they fail something. Even if they fail and suffer frustration, they won't get hurt very much. They just think of ways to overcome failures. Because they know that with a little more effort, they can experience other successes.

What is the result of the level of your child for self-esteem with above features? In the next post, the characteristics of child with low self-esteem will be introduced.

items.heading: No fear to have relationships with other people
